item.title: Student Insurance Plan Change for 2025 - 2026
item.description: The RPI student health insurance plan has renewed for the 2025-2026 year. There are no changes to the insurance benefits and there is no increase in the health insurance fee. However, there has been a change in the insurance carrier. The new carrier is Aetna. Students are encouraged to complete enrollment on the insurance portal to activate their health insurance benefits. The deadline to waive out of the plan is September 1st.

item.title: Fellowship info Session to Highlight Competitions for Grad School Salary and Tuition | Sept. 3
item.description: Date: Wednesday, September 3, 2025 3:00 PM - 4:00 PM - Competitive fellowships provide salary and tuition for masters and PhD students. Seniors and graduate students will learn how to find and apply to appropriate programs that will fund fall 2026 and beyond. Programs are available for all stages of your academic career. International students are welcome! Register for the virtual session. Email madige@rpi.edu for information.

item.title: CCPD & Western Digital HDD Teardown Workshop | Sept. 10
item.description: Join the CCPD and Western Digital for the popular HDD Teardown Workshop on Wednesday, September 10th from 5-6pm! Learn from Western Digital team members as they discuss types of cloud storage and lead you through a hands-on opportunity to disassemble a hard drive. Space is limited–register and learn more in Handshake! More information & Registration: https://rpi.joinhandshake.com/events/1789804/share_preview

item.title: TOPOS 2025: Sarah Davachi premieres The Rose Dialogues with pre-concert talk | Aug. 29
item.description: Date: Friday, August 29, 2025 6:00 PM - 8:30 PM - TOPOS is proud to present the world premiere of a newly commissioned work by Sarah Davachi, a leading voice in contemporary experimental music. The Rose Dialogues, scored for two violas, cello, organ, and electronics, begins with the canon form and unfolds into an expansive exploration of harmony, resonance, and temporal suspension. Davachi’s music doesn’t declare itself; it reveals itself. If you follow her work, you already know: these moments…

item.title: Division of Human Resources: Getting the Most from Percipio (Getting Started with Percipio: Navigation Q&A) | Sept. 5
item.description: Date: Friday, September 5, 2025 9:00 AM - 9:30 AM - This brief course is designed to help you get comfortable using Percipio, RPI’s digital learning platform. You’ll learn how to navigate the main dashboard, search for content, access assigned learning, and track your progress. We’ll also walk through common questions users have and show you where to find help when needed. Whether you’re brand new or just need a refresher, this session will ensure you’re ready to make the most of Percipio.

item.title: CBE’s 2025 Birnboim Lecture Series features Dr. Nitash Balsara | Sept. 3
item.description: Date: Wednesday, September 3, 2025 9:15 AM - 10:15 AM - The Professor Meyer H. Birnboim Endowed Lecture Series, a joint lecture series between Chemical and Biological Engineering and Physics, features Dr. Nitash Balsara, a Professor from U.C. Berkeley. Dr. Balsara’s lecture, “Movement of Polymer Molecules under Electric Fields and Relevance to Rechargeable Batteries” is open to all. Refreshments will be available in the CBIS Auditorium Gallery at 8:45 a.m.

item.title: Todd Przybycien Named Head of RPI’s Howard P. Isermann Department of Chemical and Biological Engineering
item.description: Todd Przybycien, Ph.D., professor of chemical and biological engineering at RPI, has been named head of RPI’s Howard P. Isermann Department of Chemical and Biological Engineering (CBE). Under Przybycien’s leadership, the department will continue to drive innovation in sustainable biopharmaceutical manufacturing, metabolic and enzyme engineering, advanced materials development, transport processes, and process systems engineering.

item.title: Pingkun Yan Named Head of RPI’s Department of Biomedical Engineering
item.description: Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute (RPI) has appointed Pingkun Yan, Ph.D., the P.K. Lashmet Career Development Chair Associate Professor at the Department of Biomedical Engineering at RPI, as head of the Department of Biomedical Engineering.

item.title: Arts Sr. Lecturer Ken Ragsdale’s new exhibition “Symphony” at Hudson’s Front Room Gallery is earning critical acclaim
item.description: Arts Sr. Lecturer Ken Ragsdale’s new exhibition “Symphony” at Hudson’s Front Room Gallery is earning critical acclaim! Hyperallergic’s Taliesin Thomas calls it “impressive” and “elegant,” while Musée Magazine’s Yu Lam Yau praises its “remarkably singular vision that immediately compels and intrigues.” Visit the Front Room Gallery this week to experience Ragsdale’s work in person. The show ends August 31.

item.title: Faculty and Staff In-Person Workshop: Get Wise with the Owl | Sept. 15
item.description:
Date: Monday, September 15, 2025 12:00 PM - 1:00 PM - Discover how to make the most of your Meeting Owl! Whether your department already has an Owl or you’re considering one, this hands-on workshop will walk you through everything you need to know — from setup and placement to an overview of benefits and key features like 360° video, automatic speaker tracking, and pairing devices.
